author: Ira Iosebashvili
title: Dollar Rises Against Emerging-Market Currencies
text:
The dollar rose against a raft of emerging-market currencies Friday, as investors faced fallout from a recent rise in U.S. yields.
The U.S. currency strengthened 1.4% against the Argentine peso, paring gains after hitting an all-time high earlier in the session. The peso has continued to fall this week after the South American country announced earlier this week that it would seek aid from the International Monetary Fund to stabilize its economy. The dollar also rose 1.4% against the Brazilian real and gained 1.9% against...
